@Test
void testReadsUncompressedBlocks() throws IOException {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0 };
    try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input))) {
        final byte[] actual = IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        assertArrayEquals(new byte[] { 'H', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o', ',', ' ', 'w', 'o', 'r', 'l', 'd', '!' }, actual);
    }
}

@Test
void testReadsUncompressedBlocksUsingSingleByteRead() throws IOException {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0 };
    try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input))) {
        final int h = a.read();
        assertEquals('H', h);
    }
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameFollowedByJunk() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x50, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // skippable frame has length 2
    2, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // content of skippable frame
    1, // content of skippable frame
    2, // bad signature
    1, // bad signature
    0x22, // bad signature
    0x4d, // bad signature
    0x18 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("garbage"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameFollowedByTooFewBytes() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x52, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // skippable frame has length 2
    2, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // content of skippable frame
    1, // content of skippable frame
    2, // too short for signature
    4 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("garbage"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameWithBadSignaturePrefix() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x60, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x18 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
            fail();
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("garbage"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameWithBadSignatureTrailer() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x51, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // broken skippable frame signature
    0x17 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("garbage"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameWithPrematureEnd() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x50, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // skippable frame has length 2
    2, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // content of skippable frame (should be two bytes)
    1 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("Premature end of stream while skipping frame"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsSkippableFrameWithPrematureEndInLengthBytes() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x55, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // should be four byte length
    2, // should be four byte length
    0, // should be four byte length
    0 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(IOException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("Premature end of data"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsStreamsWithBadContentChecksum() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, with content checksum
    0x64, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    (byte) 185, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, 1, 2, 3, 4 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input))) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("content checksum mismatch"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsStreamsWithoutContentChecksum() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, with content checksum
    0x64, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    (byte) 185, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0 };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input))) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("content checksum"));
}

@Test
void testRejectsTrailingBytesAfterValidFrame() {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // too short for any signature
    0x56, // too short for any signature
    0x2a, // too short for any signature
    0x4d };
    final IOException ex = assertThrows(CompressorException.class, () -> {
        try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
            IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        }
    }, "expected exception");
    assertTrue(ex.getMessage().contains("garbage"));
}

@Test
void testSkipsOverSkippableFrames() throws IOException {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x5f, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // skippable frame has length 2
    2, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // content of skippable frame
    1, // content of skippable frame
    2, // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 1 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    1, // 1 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 1 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 1 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0 };
    try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
        final byte[] actual = IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        assertArrayEquals(new byte[] { 'H', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o', ',', ' ', 'w', 'o', 'r', 'l', 'd', '!', '!' }, actual);
    }
}

@Test
void testSkipsOverTrailingSkippableFrames() throws IOException {
    final byte[] input = { // signature
    4, // signature
    0x22, // signature
    0x4d, // signature
    0x18, // flag - Version 01, block independent, no block checksum, no content size, no content checksum
    0x60, // block size 4MB
    0x70, // checksum
    115, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    13, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    0, // 13 bytes length and uncompressed bit set
    (byte) 0x80, // content
    'H', // content
    'e', // content
    'l', // content
    'l', // content
    'o', // content
    ',', // content
    ' ', // content
    'w', // content
    'o', // content
    'r', // content
    'l', // content
    'd', // content
    '!', // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // empty block marker
    0, // skippable frame signature
    0x51, // skippable frame signature
    0x2a, // skippable frame signature
    0x4d, // skippable frame signature
    0x18, // skippable frame has length 2
    2, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // skippable frame has length 2
    0, // content of skippable frame
    1, // content of skippable frame
    2 };
    try (InputStream a = new FramedLZ4CompressorInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(input), true)) {
        final byte[] actual = IOUtils.toByteArray(a);
        assertArrayEquals(new byte[] { 'H', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o', ',', ' ', 'w', 'o', 'r', 'l', 'd', '!' }, actual);
    }
}
